intro: Symphytum davisii subsp. naxicola, commonly known as the Naxos woundwort, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, somewhat fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
